summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview transcript from April 7, 2022, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons electronics technician regarding the camera system at MCC New York around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview focuses on camera system issues, upgrade contracts, and Epstein's last phone call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death in August 2019 is the subject of the OIG investigation. Mentioned in relation to camera system issues and his last phone call.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: The death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York, which prompted the OIG investigation.

events.title: Camera system failure discovered
events.description: SIS Lieutenant discovered cameras were not recording and unable to retrieve video footage from Unit 5 South Housing Unit.

events.title: Epstein's last phone call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call from SHU at 6:58 p.m. that lasted approximately 21 minutes.

keyFacts: The interview reveals significant camera system failures at MCC New York in August 2019, with cameras not recording and unable to retrieve video footage.
The witness stated he told SigNet to hold off shipping cameras in 2018 due to storage issues and part number problems, and cameras weren't shipped until after Epstein's death.
The witness confirmed that as of August 2019, only one housing unit had been prepared for camera installation due to infrastructure limitations.
The witness pulled phone records showing Epstein's last call on August 9, 2019, at 6:58 p.m. from SHU, lasting approximately 21 minutes.
The witness had no formal training on the NiceVision camera system and learned everything on the job.
